summary: The "Raise the Age Act of 2025" amends Title 18 of the United States Code to prohibit federal firearms licensees from selling or delivering certain semiautomatic centerfire rifles or shotguns to individuals under 21 years of age. Exceptions are made for active-duty military personnel and full-time law enforcement officers. The bill also mandates a report from the FBI regarding the operation of its public access line, focusing on information sharing protocols.
